description:
Skiing Norway, Gopro Hero 9 Black, Superview, POV ski touring footage in 5k resolution. On top of the World! Randonee Skiing & Climbing, Hiking Norways Northern Grubbå on perfect Powder snow day. Ski mountaineering alone in Sirdal in western Norway in February 2021 in stunning sunshine and no wind. "Topptur" in Norwegian, Hiking, Backpacking. "Life in fresh air"

Norwegian Xplorer Backpacking Hiking Skiing Mountaineering Climbing

Yellowstone, Teton Wilderness, Absarokas Virtual Hike, Backpacking Wyoming, Continental Divide POV. An 8 day virtual backpacking hike in the Greater Yellowstone area, including the headwaters of the Yellowstone river, the Thorofare, Rampart and Open Creek, The Continental Divide and many other places. Did this trip with My Own Frontier, one of the best trips I have been on.

Here is a much longer version of the trip, including a full storyline https://youtu.be/h2ZqaqCyS48

Big thanks to My Own Frontier for planning and suggesting the route and inviting me!

Epic views from the summit of Mt Baldy, February 17th, 2020. View of San Gorgonio, San Jacinto in 4k Ultra HD

This is a video of the stunning views from the summit of Mt Baldy, captured in 4k on Feb 17th, 2020. You can see SoCal from the high desert, San Gorgonio, San Jacinto, Mt Baden-Powell, Mt Wilson and more. Just a peaceful little moment.

Music by Melantopia

https://open.spotify.com/artist/536Z5d0oUiDqAuYLlsTDtG?si=ADG6SEp4QliDxhMeGHqnVA

https://music.apple.com/no/artist/melantopia/1176297721

This is a first person virtual backpacking hike to the Summit of Mount Whitney via Mt Langley, Miter Basin, Crabtree Meadow and Pass, starting from Horseshoe Meadow and ending at Whitney Portal. A POV hike view of one of the most amazing trails in the world, and part of the John Muir Trail (JMT). For those of you that want to hike this together with me on a treadmill or maybe those looking to secure permits for the 2021 season of the JMT, PCT or Mount Whitney Summit. 6 days of walking in 44 minutes.

At the request of some viewers, here is the Alltrails route of this entire trip https://www.alltrails.com/explore/map/sierras-day-1-c0f971d?u=m

#mountwhitney #mtwhitney #backpacking

Escalante South Backpacking full enhanced version, Coyote Gulch, Stevens Arch, view of Monument Valley, Capitol Reef, Utah, view of Lake Powell in 4k Ultra HD with My Own Frontier.

This is the full version of the Escalante South route created by Steve Allen, that I did with my buddy Joey of My Own Frontier in the fall of 2019. Since I am not able to get out there and record new videos because of Covid-19, I have spent time and enhanced the colors and stabilization of the previous two part videos and made it into one full and much better looking video.

We did Coyote Gulch, Crack in the Wall, Stevens Arch, Stevens Canyon, The Baker Trail, WaterPocket Fold, Cliff, Georges Camp Canyon, Escalante River, Ezra MC bench, Fools Canyon, Kings Bench and climbed out Jacob Hamblin arch to finish an epic loop. There had been no rain in over 100 days when we did the trip, so water was a main concern, there were also multiple 4+ and lower 5 class scrambles and climbs that where challenging with heavy packs. We used maps from National Geographic and Steve Allens Canyoneering 2 book for navigation, as well as the Alltrails app for gps location. Gear from Osprey, Arcteryx, La Sportiva, Fjallreven, REI, Marmot, Mountian Hardwear, Paria Outdoors, Bergans of Norway and MSR. Inspired by Michael Kelly, Steve Allen, Lars Monsen, Roal Amundsen and many more...

ASMR Soothing SoCal mountain views, Southern California calming views, Mt Baldy, Joshua Tree, San Jacinto, San Gorgonio- Baden-Powell. Mindful, relaxing, meditative views.

This is a little video I put together for everyone who misses the views from the Mountains, or for anyone who needs a little time out to calm the mind and meditate on some beautiful mountain views in the middle of the Corona crisis. The are views from Mt Baden-Powell, Mt Baldy, San Gorgonio, Joshua Tree and Mt San Jacinto. Footage from before February 2020. Mindfulness.

Rae Lakes Loop, Sequoia Kings Canyon National Park, backpacking Paradise Valley, Mist Falls, JMT 4k, the Crown of the Sierra Nevada.

This is a 5 day backpacking trip in Sequoia Kings Canyon National Park, doing the Rae Lakes loop with my new buddies Chuck The Mauler and Matt. We did this loop from Onion Valley going over Kersarge Pass and continuing counter clockwise. Our Camps where at Gilbert Lake, Charlotte Lake, Arrowhead Lake, then we split up and I camp one night a few miles below Junction Meadow to exit at Kersarge Pass the next day. Lots of wildlife, bears, dear, snakes and amazing views from one of the most stunning places in the Sierra. Paradise Valley, Mist Falls, Bubbs Creek, Glen Pass, Woods Creek, Arrow Creek. JMT (John Muir Trail) PCT (Pacific Crest Trail). I filmed this on my iPhone 11 Pro Max in 4k60fps.

Bear Safety info from NPS https://www.nps.gov/subjects/bears/safety.htm

Link to my previous Sequoia National Park Video https://youtu.be/o47VHI2SLXk

Link to the full Bear Standoff video https://youtu.be/eFi7hjwiXP4

Ski Canyoneering Norway, Spring 2021, Can we get through this Canyon, Ski Touring on Randonee skis?

We ran into this cool canyon while heading for a peak in Sirdal, Norway. We decided to see if we could get through it on skis despite the melting potholes, cornices and thawing overhanging snow and ice...come join us!

This is a video from the most beautiful snow day I have witnessed, going up to the Ski Hut from Manker Flat by Mt Baldy. This was just after a big snow storm and the scenery was stunning with beautiful snow covering everything on the way up to the Ski Hut. I filmed this on November 30th with an iPhone 11 Pro Max, shooting in 4k 60fps.

Music by Melantopia 
https://open.spotify.com/album/1Ad0M4JRdu0ZpsVVFJEfnh?si=dSzjwxtiRUqu3z1EpBsSeg
https://music.apple.com/no/artist/melantopia/1176297721

Join me on my climb to San Gorgonio Mountain from Vivian Creek trailhead in 4k, filmed on May 18th, 2019. A 17 mile roundtrip with and elevation gain of around 5500 ft. A storm was expected in the evening, but the weather held through the day and made for some spectacular sights. The scenery on top of the mountain was like a winter wonderland, everything was covered in shiny beautiful ice crystals, glittering and reflecting in the sun. Make sure to watch the final ascent to the summit of the mountain where it is all captured in beautiful 4k resolution. Views from the top of San Gorgonio are stunning, with Mt San Jacinto, Mt Baldy, Joshua tree national park, Big Bear, the Mojave desert and many other peaks and places in plain sight. The summit of San Gorgonio Mountain sits at an elevation  of 11506 ft, or just over 3500 meters, and is the highest peak in SoCal.

Norway, Early Season Spring Backpacking During Spring Runoff, Snow Melt and Waterfalls 4k

I went out on a peaceful solo backpacking trip in the mountains of South Western Norway during the amazing spring runoff, melting snow and gushing creeks, rivers and waterfalls, I spent a lot of time capturing the cascades of rushing water and enjoying the onset of spring. Also trying out a new Hilleberg Nallo 3 tent.

Norwegian Xplorer Backpacking Hiking Skiing Mountaineering Climbing

Greater Yellowstone, Teton Wilderness, The Absarokas, Part 2 Backpacking from the Headwaters of the Mighty Yellowstone River to Thorofare Creek, Glacier Basin, Overlook Mountain, Rampart Creek. Outside the boundaries of Yellowstone National Park, this is Wild America with My Own Frontier.

Watch part 1 here: https://youtu.be/t6tgApz_2NM

This day 4-8 of an 8 day backpacking trip with my buddy Joey of @myownfrontier in the Greater Yellowstone, Teton Wilderness area. This is Wild America at its best as far as my experience goes. We go into some of the most wild and remote areas of the lower 48 states and find the headwaters of the Mighty Yellowstone River in the previous video, in this video we find the headwaters of Thorofare Creek. Amazing vistas and views as we traverse the Continental Divide in the middle of an incredible wildflower bloom. Stunning waterfalls, meadows, mountains and creek crossings everywhere in prime Grizzly country. This part showing days 4-8 takes us from the North Fork of the Yellowstone River, over to and through the Thorofare Creek drainage, Open Valley, Overlook Mountain, Overlook Mountain Pass, Glacier Basin, Rampart Creek and much more. We didnt see any people except for the first and last day. This trip is from outside the boundaries of Yellowstone National Park.
